document_data.name: Orison
document_data.mainbody: An '''orison''' was the divine spellcasting equivalent to ''[[Cantrip (spell)|cantrip]]''. Priests of all mythoi learned various ''orisons'' as acolytes.

Effects.Alleviate: Gave temporary relief from pain or nausea to a sick or wounded creature.
Effects.Calm: Soothed a creature that had been startled or frightened.
Effects.Clarity: Gave the priest the ability to speak clearly and be heard, usually when performing rites and rituals.
Effects.Courage: Gave the priest a momentary boost to combat prowess.
Effects.Guidance: Gave the priest clarity of thought to make better decisions.
Effects.Healing: Allowed a healing touch for minor cuts and scratches.
Effects.Magic sense: Gave a slight prickle of awareness when near a steady magic effect or item.
Effects.Memory: For the duration of the spell, sights, sounds, and/or text and speech the caster wishes to remember are engraved in memory and are more likely to be recalled exactly as they were initially experienced.
Effects.Resistance to magic: The caster gains a slightly better resistance to magical effects for one exposure to undesirable magic, or until the spell ends, whichever comes first.
Effects.Resistance to poison:
The caster gains a better chance to overcome the effects of one exposure to a poisonous substance, or until the spell ends, whichever comes first.

Worshipers of [[evil]] or [[chaotic]] [[deities]] had offensive ''orisons'', but they were quite rare.

document_data.Components: Only [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components were required to cast these minor spells.
